The preparations<S>4633</S> of the heart<S>3820</S> in man<S>120</S>, and the answer<S>4617</S> of the tongue<S>3956</S>, is from the LORD<S>3068</S>. <sup>preparations: or, disposings</sup>
All the ways<S>1870</S> of a man<S>376</S> are clean<S>2134</S> in his own eyes<S>5869</S>; but the LORD<S>3068</S> weigheth<S>8505</S> the spirits<S>7307</S>.
Commit<S>1556</S> thy works<S>4639</S> unto the LORD<S>3068</S>, and thy thoughts<S>4284</S> shall be established<S>3559</S>. <sup>Commit: Heb. Roll</sup>
The LORD<S>3068</S> hath made<S>6466</S> all things for himself<S>4617</S>: yea, even the wicked<S>7563</S> for the day<S>3117</S> of evil<S>7451</S>.
Every one that is proud<S>1362</S> in heart<S>3820</S> is an abomination<S>8441</S> to the LORD<S>3068</S>: though hand<S>3027</S> join in hand<S>3027</S>, he shall not be unpunished<S>5352</S>. <sup>unpunished: Heb. held innocent</sup>
By mercy<S>2617</S> and truth<S>571</S> iniquity<S>5771</S> is purged<S>3722</S>: and by the fear<S>3374</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> men depart<S>5493</S> from evil<S>7451</S>.
When a man's<S>376</S> ways<S>1870</S> please<S>7521</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, he maketh even his enemies<S>341</S> to be at peace<S>7999</S> with him.
Better<S>2896</S> is a little<S>4592</S> with righteousness<S>6666</S> than great<S>7230</S> revenues<S>8393</S> without right<S>4941</S>.
A man's<S>120</S> heart<S>3820</S> deviseth<S>2803</S> his way<S>1870</S>: but the LORD<S>3068</S> directeth<S>3559</S> his steps<S>6806</S>.
A divine sentence<S>7081</S> is in the lips<S>8193</S> of the king<S>4428</S>: his mouth<S>6310</S> transgresseth<S>4603</S> not in judgment<S>4941</S>. <sup>A divine: Heb. Divination</sup>
A just<S>4941</S> weight<S>6425</S> and balance<S>3976</S> are the LORD'S<S>3068</S>: all the weights<S>68</S> of the bag<S>3599</S> are his work<S>4639</S>. <sup>the weights: Heb. the stones</sup>
It is an abomination<S>8441</S> to kings<S>4428</S> to commit<S>6213</S> wickedness<S>7562</S>: for the throne<S>3678</S> is established<S>3559</S> by righteousness<S>6666</S>.
Righteous<S>6664</S> lips<S>8193</S> are the delight<S>7522</S> of kings<S>4428</S>; and they love<S>157</S> him that speaketh<S>1696</S> right<S>3477</S>.
The wrath<S>2534</S> of a king<S>4428</S> is as messengers<S>4397</S> of death<S>4194</S>: but a wise<S>2450</S> man<S>376</S> will pacify<S>3722</S> it.
In the light<S>216</S> of the king's<S>4428</S> countenance<S>6440</S> is life<S>2416</S>; and his favour<S>7522</S> is as a cloud<S>5645</S> of the latter rain<S>4456</S>.
How much better<S>2896</S> is it to get<S>7069</S> wisdom<S>2451</S> than gold<S>2742</S>! and to get<S>7069</S> understanding<S>998</S> rather to be chosen<S>977</S> than silver<S>3701</S>!
The highway<S>4546</S> of the upright<S>3477</S> is to depart<S>5493</S> from evil<S>7451</S>: he that keepeth<S>5341</S> his way<S>1870</S> preserveth<S>8104</S> his soul<S>5315</S>.
Pride<S>1347</S> goeth before<S>6440</S> destruction<S>7667</S>, and an haughty<S>1363</S> spirit<S>7307</S> before<S>6440</S> a fall<S>3783</S>.
Better<S>2896</S> it is to be of an humble<S>8217</S> spirit<S>7307</S> with the lowly<S>6035</S> <S>6041</S>, than to divide<S>2505</S> the spoil<S>7998</S> with the proud<S>1343</S>.
He that handleth a matter<S>1697</S> wisely<S>7919</S> shall find<S>4672</S> good<S>2896</S>: and whoso trusteth<S>982</S> in the LORD<S>3068</S>, happy<S>835</S> is he. <sup>handleth: or, understandeth a matter</sup>
The wise<S>2450</S> in heart<S>3820</S> shall be called<S>7121</S> prudent<S>995</S>: and the sweetness<S>4986</S> of the lips<S>8193</S> increaseth<S>3254</S> learning<S>3948</S>.
Understanding<S>7922</S> is a wellspring<S>4726</S> of life<S>2416</S> unto him that hath<S>1167</S> it: but the instruction<S>4148</S> of fools<S>191</S> is folly<S>200</S>.
The heart<S>3820</S> of the wise<S>2450</S> teacheth<S>7919</S> his mouth<S>6310</S>, and addeth<S>3254</S> learning<S>3948</S> to his lips<S>8193</S>. <sup>teacheth: Heb. maketh wise</sup>
Pleasant<S>5278</S> words<S>561</S> are as an honeycomb<S>6688</S> <S>1706</S>, sweet<S>4966</S> to the soul<S>5315</S>, and health<S>4832</S> to the bones<S>6106</S>.
There is<S>3426</S> a way<S>1870</S> that seemeth right<S>3477</S> unto<S>6440</S> a man<S>376</S>, but the end<S>319</S> thereof are the ways<S>1870</S> of death<S>4194</S>.
He<S>5315</S> that laboureth<S>6001</S> laboureth<S>5998</S> for himself; for his mouth<S>6310</S> craveth<S>404</S> it of him. <sup>He: Heb. The soul of him that</sup> <sup>craveth: Heb. boweth unto him</sup>
An ungodly<S>1100</S> man<S>376</S> diggeth up<S>3738</S> evil<S>7451</S>: and in his lips<S>8193</S> there is as a burning<S>6867</S> fire<S>784</S>. <sup>An: Heb. A man of Belial</sup>
A froward<S>8419</S> man<S>376</S> soweth<S>7971</S> strife<S>4066</S>: and a whisperer<S>5372</S> separateth<S>6504</S> chief friends<S>441</S>. <sup>soweth: Heb. sendeth forth</sup>
A violent<S>2555</S> man<S>376</S> enticeth<S>6601</S> his neighbour<S>7453</S>, and leadeth<S>3212</S> him into the way<S>1870</S> that is not good<S>2896</S>.
He shutteth<S>6095</S> his eyes<S>5869</S> to devise<S>2803</S> froward things<S>8419</S>: moving<S>7169</S> his lips<S>8193</S> he bringeth<S>3615</S> evil<S>7451</S> to pass<S>3615</S>.
The hoary head<S>7872</S> is a crown<S>5850</S> of glory<S>8597</S>, if it be found<S>4672</S> in the way<S>1870</S> of righteousness<S>6666</S>.
He that is slow<S>750</S> to anger<S>639</S> is better<S>2896</S> than the mighty<S>1368</S>; and he that ruleth<S>4910</S> his spirit<S>7307</S> than he that taketh<S>3920</S> a city<S>5892</S>.
The lot<S>1486</S> is cast<S>2904</S> into the lap<S>2436</S>; but the whole disposing<S>4941</S> thereof is of the LORD<S>3068</S>.
